name: Listen
to
‘Adrenaline’,
the
punchy
new
track
by
Blink-182
and
All
Time
Low
supergroup
Simple
Creatures
content:
The band's debut EP arrives this FridaySimple Creatures have shared ‘Adrenaline’, another cut from their upcoming debut EP ‘Strange Love’.Blink-182’s Mark Hoppus and All Time Low’s Alex Gaskarth head-up the new supergroup, who debuted their new track on Zane Lowe’s Beats 1 World Record radio show today (March 25).
Some of the lyrics in the punchy new song include: “But I can feel you all the way/From my coffin in L.A./When I’m six feet underneath my misery/Come and hit me with adrenaline.”The track arrives a few days ahead of ‘Strange Love’, which drops this Friday, March 29 via BMG.It follows the release of lead single ‘Drug’ and the EP’s title track, both of which were shared earlier this year.Simple Creatures recently announced their debut UK gig at London’s Hangar on April 3.Tickets for the band’s first tour are on sale now – see dates below:MARCH28 – Belasco Ballroom, Los Angeles, California
29 – The Midway, San Francisco, California
31 – Warehouse on Watts, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania APRIL1 – Public Arts, New York, NY
3 – Hangar, London, EnglandSpeaking about Simple Creatures’ debut EP, Hoppus said in a press release: “Strange Love’ is the first glimpse into the Simple Creatures universe.“Cooked up in studios and basements around Los Angeles, we set out to push ourselves in musical directions that are new and exciting to us. Embracing new recording techniques and processes, we broke songs down to their barest bones and rebuilt them into musical Frankenstein monsters.”
